description: This Java source file defines the RequestReceiver class, which implements a server that listens on a specified port for incoming requests, deserializes them using Jackson, and executes associated actions. It manages starting and stopping a thread that handles socket connections and request processing, including sending a synchronization response.

classes.name: RequestReceiver
classes.description: A server class that listens on a specified port, accepts socket connections, and processes requests by deserializing incoming data and executing the requests within a dedicated thread.

classes.name: RequestReceiver.ReceiverThread
classes.description: An inner class extending Thread that runs the socket listening loop, deserializes requests, and handles request execution and thread shutdown.

methods.name: RequestReceiver(int)
methods.description: Constructor that initializes the server to listen on the specified port.

methods.name: start
methods.description: Starts the server socket and the receiver thread to begin listening for incoming requests.

methods.name: stop
methods.description: Stops the receiver thread and closes the server socket, stopping the request listening server.

methods.name: ReceiverThread.run
methods.description: Main logic loop of the receiver thread: sets up JSON deserializer, prepares sync response, accepts incoming socket connections, reads requests, responds, and executes requests.
